title.narrative: Expansion of HIV Prevention Counselling, Psychosocial Support and Outreach Services

description.narrative: The Expansion of HIV Prevention Counselling, Psychosocial Support and Outreach Services a CDC funded project has reduced mother –to-child HIV transmission and provided support services to partners and families. Now in its final year, Pathfinder worked with 1 NGO and 4 CBO partners to implement a comprehensive peer mother model that integrated partner involvement, and healthy reproductive health practices for HIV negative mothers into its wide range of activities. The peer mother component was implemented in 5 districts, covering 36 health facilities, and 60 service providers. During the course of this four year project, Over 2400 first time HIV positive mothers were registered in project facilities and 5500 HIV positive mothers received PMTCT information and engaged in behaviour change learning opportunities.
